title: Add notebook for training QA models
body: Add notebook that shows how to train a QA model

title: Remove deprecated packages
body: Fully deprecate and remove txtai.extractor and txtai.tokenizer packages. Downstream systems simply need to change the package to txtai.pipeline.

title: Get multiple translation candidates in translation pipeline
body:
Hello,

is it possible to get (for example) the best five translation results from the Hugging Face models or only one translation for a single sentence?

title: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'transformers.hf_api'
body:
With no changes to my code, Streamlit is now failing with:

```Python
2021-09-02 05:17:40.602 Loading faiss.
2021-09-02 05:17:40.620 Successfully loaded faiss.
2021-09-02 05:17:43.062 Uncaught app exception
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/app/km-streamlit/streamlit_app.py", line 8, in <module>
```

Could this be a HF breaking change?

title: Support QA models in Trainer pipeline
body: Currently, the Trainer pipeline supports training text classification models. Add support for question-answering models.

title: Fix issues with latest Transformers version
body:
Transformers 4.10.0 has caused a couple breaking changes for txtai:

- Removed transformers.hf_api package in favor of using the huggingface_hub package, which is in Transformers 4.8.2+ (current version required for txtai). Need to update the package import. 
- The ZeroShotClassificationPipeline changed the default truncation strategy to DO_NOT_TRUNCATE but doesn't currently have a way to set truncation. Will add work around to address.
- The auto model structure changed. Need to update ONNX methods to handle Lazy Auto Mapping. Still need to support old structure since 4.8.2.

title: Add ONNX support for Embeddings and Pipelines
body:
Add ONNX support for Embeddings and Pipelines.

Sequence to Sequence models (summarization, transcription, translation) will be added later once ONNX support for encoder-decoder models is more mature.

title: Add notebook for ONNX pipeline
body: Add notebook that shows how to export to ONNX and shows how an ONNX model can be run in other programming languages.

title: Add ONNX export pipeline
body: Add pipeline to export models to ONNX. The pipeline should support standard Hugging Face models and mean pooling models used for embeddings vectors.

title: Multilingual CLIP with M-CLIP/M-BERT-Base-ViT-B
body:
I am trying to index embeddings with a multilingual clip model, following [Huggingface M-BERT-Base-ViT-B instructions](https://huggingface.co/M-CLIP/M-BERT-Base-ViT-B).  After downloading weights and running my code from within the [Multilingual-CLIP](https://github.com/FreddeFrallan/Multilingual-CLIP) repository. 

````Python
embeddings = Embeddings({"method": "transformers", "path": "M-CLIP/M-BERT-Base-ViT-B"})
embeddings.index(images())
````

But getting the following error. 

```Python
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/ec2-user/Multilingual-CLIP/17-08-21-embed.py", line 72, in <module>
    process()
  File "/home/ec2-user/Multilingual-CLIP/17-08-21-embed.py", line 66, in process
    embeddings.index(images())
  File "/home/ec2-user/miniconda3/envs/txtai/lib/python3.9/site-packages/txtai/embeddings/base.py", line 76, in index
    ids, dimensions, embeddings = self.vectors(documents)
  File "/home/ec2-user/miniconda3/envs/txtai/lib/python3.9/site-packages/txtai/embeddings/base.py", line 399, in vectors
    ids, dimensions, stream = self.model.index(documents)
  File "/home/ec2-user/miniconda3/envs/txtai/lib/python3.9/site-packages/txtai/vectors/transformers.py", line 63, in index
    uids, dimensions = self.batch(batch, output)
  File "/home/ec2-user/miniconda3/envs/txtai/lib/python3.9/site-packages/txtai/vectors/transformers.py", line 90, in batch
    embeddings = self.model.encode(documents)
  File "/home/ec2-user/miniconda3/envs/txtai/lib/python3.9/site-packages/txtai/vectors/pooling.py", line 63, in encode
    lengths = np.argsort([-len(x) for x in documents])
  File "/home/ec2-user/miniconda3/envs/txtai/lib/python3.9/site-packages/txtai/vectors/pooling.py", line 63, in <listcomp>
    lengths = np.argsort([-len(x) for x in documents])
TypeError: object of type 'JpegImageFile' has no len()
```

Could this be related to requiring embeddings with MEAN pooling?

title: OSError: Error no file named ['pytorch_model.bin', 'tf_model.h5', 'model.ckpt.index', 'flax_model.msgpack']
body:
My Embeddings were indexed using **txtai==3.1.0**

```python
embeddings = Embeddings({"method": "transformers", "path": "clip-ViT-B-32", "modelhub": False})
embeddings.index(images())
```

But now using **txtai==3.2.0** I get the following error after initialising Embeddings following example [Image.py](https://github.com/neuml/txtai/blob/master/examples/images.py) for a streamlit application

`embeddings = Embeddings({"path": os.path.join(os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(__file__)), 'clip-ViT-B-32') , "method": "transformers", "modelhub": True})`

I am copying clip-ViT-B-32 directory to the container in the Dockerfile to avoid streamlit downloading it. I'm not sure if the path is correct. 

Tested locally with `docker-compose up --build streamlit` using [streamlit-cdk-fargate](https://github.com/tzaffi/streamlit-cdk-fargate) as a guide.  I have succesfully deployed the streamlit app this way- all that has changed now, is new embeddings and possibly updated python requirements.

title: Update notebooks and example applications
body: Update notebooks and example applications with latest version of txtai.

title: Improve performance when running models through transformers
body: Loading models with transformers has caused a performance regression. Investigate and fix.

title: Add vector method for sentence-transformers
body:
Currently, setting modelhub to false enables the sentence-transformers library. But sentence-transformers now supports directly loading from the Hugging Face Model Hub which is confusing. 

The modelhub parameter should be removed in favor of setting the vector method = "sentence-transformers" to enable using the sentence-transformers library to build embeddings.

title: Infer vector method using path
body:
Currently, if a vector method is not provided with a new Embeddings object, it defaults to Word Vectors. Word Vectors are no longer installed in the base package (see #97), so this is no longer the best logic. 

This change will infer the method using the path. New logic should be:

- If path is a file, set the method to use Word Vectors.
- Otherwise, the method will be set to use Transformers models. 

This should work in almost all cases and the method should no longer need to be explicitly set.

title: Change tokenization to default to false for TransformerVectors
body: Currently, TransformersVectors defaults to running all text through a default English language tokenizer. This doesn't increase accuracy with current Sentence Transformer models and breaks non-English models. It should only be enabled when specifically set.

title: Evaluate if faiss-cpu can be used as default across all platforms
body: Currently, Windows defaults to Annoy for the backend ANN and Linux/macOS defaults to Faiss. Evaluate if Linux/macOS/Windows can all default to the latest faiss-cpu package.

title: Modularize txtai install
body:
txtai has grown over the last year to being both an similarity search engine and pipeline/workflow engine. A full install is requiring a lot of libraries, which possibly discourages installs.

Modify setup.py to have optional installations for:

- API
- Less common ANN packages
- Workflows

title: Add Trainer pipeline
body:
Add a pipeline to train new Hugging Face models using the Trainer framework.

This pipeline will support the following:

- Building transient models without requiring an output directory
- Load training data from Hugging Face datasets, pandas DataFrames and list of dicts
- Text sequence classification tasks (single/multi label classification and regression) including all GLUE tasks
- All training arguments

Some examples of how the functionality will work:

```python
import pandas as pd

from datasets import load_dataset

from txtai.pipeline import HFTrainer

trainer = HFTrainer()

# Pandas DataFrame
df = pd.read_csv("training.csv")
model, tokenizer = trainer("bert-base-uncased", df)

# Hugging Face dataset
ds = load_dataset("glue", "sst2")
model, tokenizer = trainer("bert-base-uncased", ds["train"], columns=("sentence", "label"))

# List of dicts
dt = [{"text": "sentence 1", "label": 0}, {"text": "sentence 2", "label": 1}]]
model, tokenizer = trainer("bert-base-uncased", dt)

# Support additional TrainingArguments
model, tokenizer = trainer("bert-base-uncased", dt, learning_rate=3e-5, num_train_epochs=5)
```

An full-featured example on how to use the Trainer API can be found here - https://github.com/huggingface/transformers/blob/master/examples/pytorch/text-classification/run_glue.py

title: Enhance Labels pipeline to support standard text classification models
body: Currently, the Labels pipeline only supports zero shot classification models (i.e. dynamic labeling). Support should be extended to fixed labels models (i.e. any ModelForSequenceClassification model).

title: Return sentences by Search
body: in order to highlight the text in the search results, is there a way to modify search function in class embedding so that the specific sentences will be returned?

title: Add wiki search example application
body: Add example that queries the Wikipedia API and summarizes the top result.

title: Add book search example application
body: Add book search example application using data from openlibrary.org

title: Clear workflow batch during processing
body: Currently, there is an issue with clearing the workflow batch, leading to incorrect processing with large batches.

title: Add notebook covering distributed embedding clusters
body: Show an example of how to build a distributed embeddings cluster

title: Switch default backend on Windows to Hnswlib
body: Currently, Windows defaults to annoy as the index backend on Windows. This should be changed to Hnswlib given that it has been support for all txtai ANN operations.

title: Add Embeddings Cluster component
body:
Add Embeddings Cluster component

- This component will manage a number of embeddings shards
- The shards will be API references
- The cluster component will mirror embeddings operations
- The API will seamlessly determine if an Embeddings or Embeddings Cluster should be created based on settings

title: Add support for update/delete embeddings index operations
body: Currently, embeddings indexes can only be created. Updates/deletes require a full index rebuild. Add support for updates/deletes for index backends (Faiss, hnswlib) that support this.

title: Add URL workflow task
body: Currently, file urls are supported. This should be changed to support any valid url.

title: Add object storage workflow task
body: Currently, files must be specified as input elements to workflows. Support should be added to also scan local directories and cloud storage buckets (aws, azure, gcs...). Use Apache libcloud abstract this functionality.

title: Add service workflow task
body: Add workflow task that executes actions against an API service. This should support both the txtai api and any other http service that returns json data.

title: Add workflow to API
body: Allow workflow executions through API

title: Add text segmentation pipeline
body: Abstract textractor text segmentation into a separate pipeline. Textractor should extend this new pipeline

title: Add workflow builder application
body: Add example application to demonstrate how to build and apply txtai workflows.

title: Add default truncation to pipelines
body:
Issue report in this comment: https://github.com/neuml/txtai/issues/74#issuecomment-817391386

Currently, pipelines will error out when text exceeds the model_max_length for a given pipeline. Add default truncation to each pipeline. Summary pipeline already has this, need to add to labels. The questions pipeline already has truncation built into the models.

title: Modularize the API
body: Currently, the API is defined in a single file. Split this out for maintainability. This will also enable API extensions.

title: Add API extensions
body: Add component to allow extending the API with custom endpoints

title: Add Pipeline Factory
body: Add class to dynamically instantiate pipelines by class name

title: Update documentation, add site through GitHub pages
body: Update documentation, add site through GitHub pages. Slim README down to quick overview with links to the details.

```
  None),
 ('00340eea543336d54adda18236424de6a5e91c9d',
  'Analysis Title: Regaining perspective on SARS-CoV-2 molecular tracing and its implications\nDuring the past three months, a new coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) epidemic has been growing exponentially, affecting over 100 thousand people worldwide, and causing enormous distress to economies and societies of affected countries. A plethora of analyses based on viral sequences has already been published, in scientific journals as well as through non-peer reviewed channels, to investigate SARS-CoV-2 genetic heterogeneity and spatiotemporal dissemination. We examined all full genome sequences currently available to assess the presence of sufficient information for reliable phylogenetic and phylogeographic studies. Our analysis clearly shows severe limitations in the present data, in light of which any finding should be considered, at the very best, preliminary and hypothesis-generating. Hence the need for avoiding stigmatization based on partial information, and for continuing concerted efforts to increase number and quality of the sequences required for robust tracing of the epidemic.',
  None),
 ('004f0f8bb66cf446678dc13cf2701feec4f36d76',
  'Healthcare-resource-adjusted vulnerabilities towards the 2019-nCoV epidemic across China\n',
  None), ...]
```


How do I fix this? I don't see anywhere in the documentation about this. I assume the error message:
``` 
Asking to truncate to max_length but no maximum length is provided and the model has no predefined maximum length. 
Default to no truncation.
```
is related, and I need to set a max_length to 512 so that any documents that are larger than 512 get truncated to 512 tokens, but I don't see anywhere how to do that...

title: Add notebooks covering new v3 functionality
body: Add notebooks covering new v3 functionality.

title: Allow direct download of sentence-transformer models
body:
Currently, only models on the Hugging Face Model Hub are supported for transformer embeddings. Not all models are uploaded to the model hub and/or some are not yet uploaded. A flag should be added to allow downloading models directly from sentence-transformers, using the existing built in logic.

Unless this is specifically enabled, models should still be required to be on the model hub.

title: Add tests for new v3 functionality
body: Incorporate new tests for all functionality introduced in v3.0.0

title: Add additional pipeline abstraction layer for tensor frameworks
body:
Currently, all pipelines extend from Hugging Face pipelines. This task will add additional abstract layers to:

- Have pipelines that use a tensor processing framework (PyTorch, TensorFlow)
- Pipelines that extend from Hugging Face models
- Pipelines that abstract Hugging Face pipelines (currently supported)

This change will allow incorporating additional types of models.

title: Add workflow framework
body:
Add framework to execute tasks to transform text. Workflows are callables that take lists of text, files and/or binary data and converts them. 

The following lists a couple different workflow examples.

Example workflow 1
  - Extract text from files
  - Split into paragraphs
  - Convert to English
  - Load into similarity index

Example workflow 2
 - Transcribe speech to text
 - Convert to French
 - Load into similarity index

Example workflow 3
 - Read image file and convert to embeddings
 - Load into similarity index

title: Add translation pipeline
body: Add pipeline that can translate text

title: Add transcription pipeline
body: Add pipeline that can transcribe speech to text

title: Add text extraction pipeline
body: Add pipeline to extract text from documents

title: Add summary pipeline
body: Use Hugging Face's summary pipeline to summarize text.

title: Modify pipeline to accept GPU device id
body: Currently, pipelines have a GPU flag to enable/disable. This parameter should also support integer device numbers. This will allow handling multi-GPU systems.

title: Refactor code into smaller components and modules
body: Currently, the main files are getting large. The code should be split up into separate module directories to improve organization of the code.

title: [Python 3.9, Mac OS] Code hangs while building embedding index
body:
Minimal example below. I suspect something weird is happening to multithreading, but was not able to confirm or find a resolution.

```
Python version - 3.9.1
OS - Mac Big Sur
```

```python
import os
import tempfile
import pandas as pd


from txtai.tokenizer import Tokenizer
from txtai.vectors import WordVectors
from txtai.embeddings import Embeddings

# generate random data
random_array = ["a" + pd.util.testing.rands_array(3, 2) for i in range(100)]
df = pd.DataFrame(random_array, columns=list("AB"))


with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(mode="w", suffix=".txt", delete=False) as output:
    tokens = output.name

    for row in range(df.shape[0]):
        output.write(" ".join(Tokenizer.tokenize(df.iloc[row, 0])) + "\n")

WordVectors.build(tokens, 10, 1, "search-data")

os.remove(tokens)

def stream():
    for row in range(df.shape[0]):
        uid = row
        tokens = Tokenizer.tokenize(df.iloc[row, 0])
        document = (uid, tokens, None)
        yield document

embeddings = Embeddings({"path": "search-data.magnitude"})

# Code hangs here
embeddings.index(stream())
```

title: Non intuitive behaviour of Tokenizer
body:
Tokenizer fails in a way that is not intuitive to the user. Pls refer example below

```python
from txtai.tokenizer import Tokenizer

Tokenizer.tokenize("abc")
# output -> ["abc"]
Tokenizer.tokenize("12c")
# output -> []
Tokenizer.tokenize("c12")
# output -> ["c12"]
```
Looking at the source comments one would believe that `12c` will be tokenized and matched.
```python
# Require strings to be at least 2 characters long.
# Require at least 1 alpha character in string.
```
At the least, user should be warned that tokenizer did not match the string & hence returned a blank.

Possible rectification:
`\d{0,1}\d*[a-z]([\-.0-9:_a-z]{1,})*$`

The assumptions of Tokenizer should also be clearer in the main documentation.

title: Require Faiss 1.7.0
body: Add faiss-cpu>=1.7.0 as dependency to help with test consistency across dependent projects.

title: Add Docker file for API
body: Given that those using the API may not use Python or want to spend time installing it, having a Docker file would be beneficial.

title: Add reranker module such as cross_encoder in sbert to this framework
body:
I have review the source code. 
Is it necessary to add a interface about reranker to improve the precision ?

title: Add example notebook that adds semantic search to existing system
body: Use similarity pipeline to add semantic search to Elasticsearch

title: Modify API add method to stream data
body: Currently, the API add method queues documents in memory. Documents should instead be queued to disk and re-streamed when indexing to allow better memory utilization at index time.

title: Allow setting ANN index parameters
body:
Currently, default values are selected for backend index parameters. ANN methods should support reading settings from the main configuration. If settings are not found, fall back to default values.

To add custom configuration a custom JSON object must be available with the key the same as the backend name (i.e. annoy, faiss, hnsw). 

- Annoy (See https://github.com/spotify/annoy)
```json
"annoy": {
  "ntrees": "number of trees (int) - defaults to 10",
  "searchk": "search_k search setting (int) - defaults to -1"
}
```
- Faiss (See https://github.com/facebookresearch/faiss/wiki/The-index-factory and https://github.com/facebookresearch/faiss/wiki/Faster-search)

```json
"faiss": {
  "components": "Comma separated list of components - defaults to None",
  "nprobe": "search probe setting (int) - defaults to 6"
}
```

- Hnswlib (See https://github.com/nmslib/hnswlib)

```json
"hnsw": {
  "efconstruction":  "ef_construction param for init_index (int) - defaults to 200",
  "m": "M param for init_index (int) - defaults to 16",
  "randomseed": "random-seed param for init_index (init) - defaults to 100",
  "efsearch": "ef search param (int) - defaults to None and not set"
}
```

title: Make API definitions consistent
body:
With the additional functionality added to txtai over the last few releases, the API definitions have gotten somewhat inconsistent. This issue will address that and make many of the return types across modules consistent. The changes are breaking in many cases and will require a bump of the major version of txtai to v2. 

The current Python API definitions for v1 are:

Current Python API v1
------------------------------

- embeddings.search("query text")
    return [(id, score)] sort score desc

- embeddings.similarity("query text", documents)
    return [score]

- embeddings.add(documents)
  embeddings.index()

- embeddings.transform("text")
    return [float]

- extractor(sections, queue)
    return [(name, answer)]

- labels("text", ["label1"])
    return [(label, score)] sort score desc

The new method templates and return types are below. 

New Python API v2
------------------------------

- embeddings.search("query text")
    return [(id, score)] sort score desc

- embeddings.batchsearch(["query text1", "query text2])
    return [[(id, score)] sort score desc]

- embeddings.add(documents)
  embeddings.index()

- embeddings.similarity("query text", texts)
    return [(id, score)] sort score desc

- embeddings.batchsimilarity(["query text1", "query text2], texts)
    return [[(id, score)] sort score desc]

- embeddings.transform("text")
  return [float]

- embeddings.batchtransform(["text1", "text2"]) 
  return [[float]]

- extractor(queue, texts)
    return [(name, answer)]

- labels("text", ["label1"])
    return [(id, score)] sort score desc

- labels(["text1", "text2"], ["label1"])
    return [[(id, score)] sort score desc]

- similarity("query text", texts)
    return [(id, score)] sort score desc

- batchsimilarity(["query text1", "query text2], texts)
    return [[(id, score)] sort score desc]

External v2 API Calls
------------------------------
The API methods also need to have corresponding changes.

Given that json doesn't support tuples and some languages can't easily map arrays/tuples to objects, the return types are mapped from tuples to json objects. For example instead of (id, score) the API will return {"id": value, "score": value}. 

The API also has the following differences with the native Python API.

- extract uses the Extractor pipeline which is a callable object in Python. 
- label/batchlabel uses the Labels pipeline which is a callable object in Python that supports both string and list input.
- similarity/batchsimilarity uses the Similarity pipeline which is a callable object in Python that supports both string and list input.

The following list shows how the API methods will look through language binding libraries. 

- embeddings.search("query text")
  embeddings.batchsearch(["query text1", "query text2])

- embeddings.add(documents)
  embeddings.index()

- embeddings.similarity("query text", texts)
  embeddings.batchsimilarity(["query text1", "query text2], texts)

- embeddings.transform("text")
  embeddings.batchTransform(["text1", "text2"])

- extractor.extract(questions, texts)

- labels.label("text", ["label1"])
  labels.batchlabel(["text1", "text2"], ["label1"])

- similarity.similarity("query text", texts)
  similarity.batchsimilarity(["query text1", "query text2], texts)

title: All methods should operate on batches
body:
For search, similarity, extractive qa and labels, all methods should operate on batches for the best performance.

- Extractive QA already supports this. 
- Search, similarity and labels should work with batches. Separate methods (if necessary) can be retained to provide existing functionality for a single record.

title: Review, organize and update example notebooks
body: Do a refresh and reorganization of the example notebooks.

title: Q&A Extractor Sample Code Not Functioning As Expected
body:
I have run the following sample code for the extractor to perform Q&A on OS X but the results return None:

```
embeddings = Embeddings({"method": "transformers", "path": "sentence-transformers/bert-base-nli-mean-tokens"})
extractor = Extractor(embeddings, "distilbert-base-cased-distilled-squad")
sections = ["Giants hit 3 HRs to down Dodgers",
            "Giants 5 Dodgers 4 final",
            "Dodgers drop Game 2 against the Giants, 5-4",
            "Blue Jays 2 Red Sox 1 final",
            "Red Sox lost to the Blue Jays, 2-1",
            "Blue Jays at Red Sox is over. Score: 2-1",
            "Phillies win over the Braves, 5-0",
            "Phillies 5 Braves 0 final",
            "Final: Braves lose to the Phillies in the series opener, 5-0",
            "Final score: Flyers 4 Lightning 1",
            "Flyers 4 Lightning 1 final",
            "Flyers win 4-1"]
sections = [(uid, section) for uid, section in enumerate(sections)]
questions = ["What team won the game?", "What was score?"]
execute = lambda query: extractor(sections, [(question, query, question, False) for question in questions])
for query in ["Red Sox - Blue Jays", "Phillies - Braves", "Dodgers - Giants", "Flyers - Lightning"]:
    print("----", query, "----")
    for answer in execute(query):
        print(answer)
    print()
```


Results:
```
---- Red Sox - Blue Jays ----
('What team won the game?', None)
('What was score?', None)

---- Phillies - Braves ----
('What team won the game?', None)
('What was score?', None)

---- Dodgers - Giants ----
('What team won the game?', None)
('What was score?', None)

---- Flyers - Lightning ----
('What team won the game?', None)
('What was score?', None)
```

title: Can we have a CONTRIBUTING.md for a quick guide?
body:
It can have sections such as:

- To contribute a feature/fix
- How can you help
- Getting Started
- Formatting and Linting rules
- Connect on Slack etc. to get help or for issues

P.S. I am new to NeuML and found this an interesting initiative. Would love to contribute!

title: Add zero-shot based similarity pipeline
body:
Currently, the embeddings model is used for calculating similarity. The Labels model backed by Hugging Face's zero shot classifier has shown an impressive level of accuracy in labelling text. 

Evaluate if this pipeline can be used to perform similarity comparisons. In this case, the input sections would be a list of documents and candidate labels would be the query.

title: Add model distillation methods
body:
Review the methods here: https://github.com/UKPLab/sentence-transformers/tree/master/examples/training/distillation

See if this can be integrated to reduce the storage necessary for embeddings indices.

title: Fix build warnings with hnswlib
body: hnswlib requires numpy and is failing on the build of the wheel. The build process is falling back to the legacy build which will be removed in pip 21.x.

title: Remove build script workaround
body:
The combination of pip 20.3.x, transformers 4.x and sentence-transformers 0.3.9 has caused build errors not related to txtai. 

Remove the following lines from build.yml once they are resolved upstream. 

```yaml
# Remove hardcoding to 20.2.4
pip install -U pip==20.2.4 wheel coverage coverall
```

title: Upgrade to Transformers 4.x
body: Transformers 4.x has numerous performance improvements. Upgrade dependency to require at least 4.0.0.

title: Refactor pipeline component
body:
Currently, the pipeline component has logic to workaround a performance issue in Transformers < 4.0. This performance issue has been resolved. Refactor this component to directly use the pipeline component.

Also consolidate labels methods into the pipeline module.

title: tokenizer.py
body:
hi，

For English, it is a right tokenizer such as 
**tokens = [token.strip(string.punctuation) for token in text.lower().split()]**
and
**return [token for token in tokens if re.match(r"^\d\*[a-z][\-.0-9:_a-z]{1,}$", token) and token not in Tokenizer.STOP_WORDS]**
But for other language, for example Chinese, it makes wrong thing, so could you please revise this for different language, or give me some advice?

Thanks!

title: Add API tests
body: The functionality provided via the txtai API has increased significantly. Improve test coverage in that area.

title: Enhance API to fully support all txtai functionality
body:
Currently, the API supports a subset of functionality in the embeddings module. Fully support embeddings and add methods qa extraction and labeling.

This will enable network-based implementations of txtai in other programming languages.

title: Refresh example notebooks and add notebook on labeling
body:
Re-run and save the example notebooks to ensure they all work with the latest libraries. 

Also add a notebook on labeling.

body:
travis-ci.org builds are frequently backlogged more than an hour, which doesn't work for continuous development. Migrate to GitHub actions.

Once successful, revoke all third-party app access.

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

body: Faiss 1.6.4 supports Windows. This upgrade will help simplify the code base on all platforms.

title: Upgrade to Faiss 1.6.4
body: Faiss 1.6.4 supports Windows. This upgrade will help simplify the code base on all platforms.

title: Split extractor embedding query and QA calls
body:
Currently, extractor.py has a single method to run an embeddings query and then run extractive QA over those results. 

This should be split into two separate methods, which allows external callers to just run the embeddings search without executing the QA extraction. This will allow downstream systems more flexibility in working with the extractor process.

title: Update 04_Extractive_QA_with_Elasticsearch.ipynb

title: Update 03_Build_an_Embeddings_index_from_a_data_source.ipynb
body: display(HTML(df.to_html(index=False))) works in a browser development environment, but will display a message like this "<IPython.core.display.HTML object>" in a local environment. Added suggestions to those who run the script in vscode or local command line environment. Instead of displaying the result to a browser, write the html result into a local file, and then use the browser to open the html file to view the result.

title: Using huggingface's datasets library as key part of the pipeline
body:
I implemented a similar customizable indexing + retrieval pipeline. [Huggingface's datasets](https://huggingface.co/docs/datasets/faiss_and_ea.html) (previously named NLP) libary allows one to vectorize index huge datasets without having to worry about RAM. They use Apache Arrow for memory mapped zero deserialization cost dataframes to do this. And It also supports easy integration with FAISS and elastic search.

Key advantages of making this the key part of the pipeline are as follows. 

1. An interface to a memory mapped dataframe which is fast. This allows running a neural model on the data and saving it and caching it very easy. 
2. `datasets` library already provides access to tonnes of datasets. Refer https://huggingface.co/datasets/viewer/. They allow adding new datasets, making it a good choice for distributing datasets which users of txtai would rely upon.

title: Update transformers requirement to latest
body:
Currently, transformers is fixed to 3.0.2 due to an issue with sentence-transformers. 

Once sentence-transformers v0.3.6 is released, which will support 3.1.x, update setup.py accordingly.

title: Add option to store word vectors with embeddings model
body: For word embedding models, add an option to include the word vectors model in the models path.

title: Add batch indexing for transformer indices
body: Currently, sentence-transformer based indices are indexing documents one at a time. Calls to sentence-transformers should be batched together to decrease indexing time.

  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 550, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.8/lib/python3.8/site-packages/transformers/modeling_t5.py", line 684, in forward
    raise ValueError("You have to specify either decoder_input_ids or decoder_inputs_embeds")

What am I missing?

Thanks!

title: [Feature] txtai as a proxy like nboost
body:
Hi,

Hope you are all well !

I was wondering if we can use **txtai** like [nboost](https://github.com/koursaros-ai/nboost) as a proxy for elasticsearch or [manticoresearch](https://github.com/manticoresoftware/manticoresearch) ?

i am really interested by an integration to manticoresearch as I wrote https://paper2code.com around this full-text search engine.

Thanks for your insights and inputs about this question.

Cheers,
X

title: ValueError: Wrong shape for input_ids (shape torch.Size([6])) or attention_mask (shape torch.Size([6]))
body:
This is the original code from Introudcing txtai.py

`import numpy as np

sections = ["US tops 5 million confirmed virus cases",
            "Canada's last fully intact ice shelf has suddenly collapsed, forming a Manhattan-sized iceberg",
            "Beijing mobilises invasion craft along coast as Taiwan tensions escalate",
            "The National Park Service warns against sacrificing slower friends in a bear attack",
            "Maine man wins $1M from $25 lottery ticket",
            "Make huge profits without work, earn up to $100,000 a day"]

print("%-20s %s" % ("Query", "Best Match"))
print("-" * 50)

for query in ("feel good story", "climate change", "health", "war", "wildlife", "asia", "north america", "dishonest junk"):
    # Get index of best section that best matches query
    uid = np.argmax(embeddings.similarity(query, sections))

    print("%-20s %s" % (query, sections[uid]))`

A problem occurs from colab when executing the following line of code:
`uid = np.argmax(embeddings.similarity(query, sections))`

It shows : "ValueError: Wrong shape for input_ids (shape torch.Size([6])) or attention_mask (shape torch.Size([6]))"

The problem doesn't occur a few days ago. 

>

title: Language and Locale
body:
Dear commiters,

I would like to use txtai for a search query purpose but currently my content is not in English, is there parameters that can be provided to improve the results based on language and locale ?

Thanks,

title: Add batch search
body:
First of all, thanks a lot for your work, it's really great !
In order to user the search on lots of documents, it would be great if we could :

- [ search batches of elements] : embeddings.search(queries, top_k) which would return a list of top_k results for each query in queries
- [use fastest lib to do so  ]  (I use hnsw implem of [nmslib](https://github.com/nmslib/nmslib) which provides a batch search and great implementation of hnsw).

Keep up the good work !

But i am getting not found error.

Regards,

title: Docker run timeout when downloading embeddings files
body:
So, I'm very new to this but I have been able to put something together with txtai.  Thanks for that!  Very interesting stuff.

I built a new index and saved it, then worked up a simple flask app to load it and interface to it.  

However, the initial embeddings line in there has to download the models from the net and this causes a timeout when trying to fire up the resulting container in Docker.   Is there a way to pre-download these files and then point to those rather than having it try and load them?    It seems to do this on my local machine, but I can not find where they are or how to reference them.  

app.py
```
import os, json, requests
import urllib.request
from flask import Flask, abort, request, jsonify
from flask import Response
from flask_cors import CORS
from flask_restful import Resource, Api
from txtai.embeddings import Embeddings

# Create embeddings model, backed by sentence-transformers & transformers
embeddings = Embeddings({"method": "transformers", "path": "sentence-transformers/bert-base-nli-mean-tokens"})
embeddings.load("index")

app = Flask(__name__)

cors = CORS(app, resources={r"/*": {"origins": "*"}})
app.config['CORS_HEADERS'] = 'Content-Type'

@app.route("/q1",  methods=['GET'])
def serch():
    q = request.args.get('q')
    results = embeddings.search(q, 10)
    data = {}  # build json from the set..
    for r in results:
        uid = r[0]
        score = r[1]
        data[str(uid)] = score
        #   print('score:{} -- {}'.format(score, text_corpus[uid]))
        print('score:{} -- {}'.format(score, uid))
    j = json.dumps(data)
    return  j

if __name__ == '__main__':
    app.run(debug=True, host='0.0.0.0', port=int(os.environ.get('PORT', 8080)))
```

Dockerfile
```
# Use the official Python image.
# https://hub.docker.com/_/python
FROM python:3.7

# Copy local code to the container image.
ENV APP_HOME /app
WORKDIR $APP_HOME
COPY . ./

# Install production dependencies.
RUN pip install Flask gunicorn
RUN pip install flask_restful
RUN pip install flask-cors
RUN pip install numpy
RUN pip install txtai

# Run the web service on container startup. Here we use the gunicorn
# webserver, with one worker process and 8 threads.
# For environments with multiple CPU cores, increase the number of workers
# to be equal to the cores available.
#CMD exec gunicorn --bind :$PORT --workers 1 --threads 8 app:app
CMD exec gunicorn --bind :8080 --workers 1 --threads 8 app:app
```
